content: One of the best apps for developing film out there.

Does it work? Yes. Does it work well? Kind of. I can't seem to be able to delete my times that I've created, and the edit button intermittently dissapears. Once I open one of my times I can't exit it without exiting the whole app. Overall for the amount of money it costs, I expected it to be better.
replyContent: Thank you for contacting us by email separately. We will need to get some more information and can then resolve any issues. We have had no other reports of these problems, so your input is important to us.

content: Indespencable.Alarm does go off unnecessarily when opening of process page,which is an irritant.

Very useful app, thanks. But please, could you make the buttons bigger please, or provide an option for large buttons? I'm trying to hit "continue" while shuffling things from one tray to the next and don't always get the button first time.
Why do you erase Shanghai GP3 from the application database? There's no point I bought this app but had to surf to the web for more complete data that once available in the app.
replyContent: Shanghai GP3 is a 120 roll film, so you need to click on the "120" tab on the top of the screen to see data for this film. If you like, you can also set the app to default to the "120" roll tab in the Settings.

content: Drives me mad. Film Developer Pro is far easier.
replyContent: Can you please contact us by email via our web site so we can assist you? The Massive Dev Chart Timer is continually updated and improved for users. It has many more features and is much more configurable than any of the copycats. Please contact us so we can show you how to use it more easily.

content: Massive? Hardly. Only 1 of my 5 developers listed. And I doubt the times are the same for 35mm and 4x5, which is what I shoot. Nice try. ..... Edit: "The data does (sic) not exist." They (the data) are on the film package. That's existential enough for me.
replyContent: We have written to you and asked you to contact us by email or via our web Support system for help, but you have not done so. Instead you post negative comments and denigrate the app with a bad review.  We have no way to work out what data you claim is missing if you do not provide us with any information, so we can only assume it is your own error

content: My go-to guide for B&W at-home developing, never fails.
Help its currently crashing on my android. Just started this morning. Opens for a split second and then closes
replyContent: The bug was fixed in version 4.1.1

content: Great resource but has quite a few maddening bugs: - The alarm sound goes off whenever you start the app - The Volume Mixer has never worked, the dilution field always says 1 + 0 + 0 + 0 no matter what you set the volume to. - You can't switch to a different application while the you are running the timers. When you switch back, it often will jump to a different phase without any input.
replyContent: Glad you like the app! The Volume Mixer and Dilution Mixer are two separate functions, so one will not affect the other. Please contact us by email via our web site so that we can diagnose the bugs you report. Once we have more information we will be able to fix things in the next update to be released very soon.

content: Needs Google Drive backup
replyContent: The cloud backup system is designed for Dropbox. We hope to incorporate Google Drive in future,  but there are currently unresolvable sync issues if we do so. You can switch on Dropbox sync in the Settings.

content: Excellent very useful app. Obviously development times will vary according to preference but these are usually good to start with. The temperature conversion option is very handy and accurate.

The first impression is very good.. But after using it for a while now I miss a few things: - Default setting for the film type (I would like to default to 120) - A way to calculate quantities for mixing fixed and stopbath without having to make a dummy recipe and misuse the developer - An option to copy a recipe to the clipboard or paste it into the app - and a little more involved, but a time for the ilford way of washing the film after development (fill water, agitate 3x, wait a minute, refill water, agitate 6x, wait a minute etc. till 24x) It saves a lot of water but I don't see it possible with the current editor.
Great app for film photography lovers
The time/temp conversion didn't work at first but now it does.
replyContent: The time/temp setting works correctly, you just need to click the checkbox before you adjust the temperature. Full instructions are here: https://www.digitaltruth.com/apps/mdc/mdc-manual-edit.php?temp

content: an overall great experience on my s10. had the iOS version and just thankful they didnt forget the android developers. wish the text and buttons covered more of the vertical of the screen space on my device since the buttons are smaller and harder to reach. optimizing for larger screen devices would give this a 5 star.
Absolute requirement. This program went the path from absolute beginner to some amateur state with always accurate timings. None ot the film rolls turned out to be bad. Thanks, dollars well spent!
Excellent support response. App is universally respected - inexperienced developers, like myself, should proceed with caution.
replyContent: Please email us or use our support forum so that we can resolve this issue for you.

content: really helpful!

Updating my rating from 3 stars to 2. The new update shows duplicated My Times entries beyond the 9th item. Deleting items or sorting this erroneous list has a destructive effect. Basically you don't know what item will be affected. Thankfully I first synced my database to Dropbox, which has a version history feature, and I was able to revert my database manually. Proceed with caution.

A great app, well and worth purchashing. I have just used it to develop 2 x Ilford fp4 films in Rodinal developer, they both came out perfectly! This app makes the whole process very straightforward, its easy to understand & very intuitive.
The Dev Chart is a wonderful tool... Antonio
the go-to app for developing your own black and white film. There are no substitutes. Moreover, if you find a time/method that works better for you, you can add it to the list as a custom time.

Not being able to to disable sound makes the app useless as an actual timer for me, so I just use it to look up and save times and use a separate timer. Me and everyone I know listens to music or audiobooks/podcasts while developing.
replyContent: If you set agitation to zero, then the only sound will be the alarm at the end of the phase; however, we also intend to add a "silent mode" to version 4.0 when it is released in a few months time which will be a free update for all users as always..

content: It's disappointing that the android app does not have color timing but the Apple one does.   In response to reply: I have been using the app for at least four years and using it in teaching photography courses, so I understand your response. To clarify, yes this app is the same as the apple, but the Darkroom Lab Timer that does include color is not available for android.
replyContent: The Android app has the identical feature set as the Apple app. Please see the User Guide on our website or contact us by email for assistance.

content: Well-designed, feature-packed product. I wish it also had the same ratio calculator for the fixing stage as it does for the developer stage.
an apps for every old film soul
Thank you for fixing the Android P bug!

Does not work with Android P. Will update my review when/if the application 
is fixed. Crashes any time I try and add a new job.
replyContent: We are aware of this issue and will be releasing an update in the next few days to fix it. Please accept our apologies, but this was a completely unforseen incompatibility which was introduced in Pie. It only affects Android Pie users and you should still be able to use the My Times tab to operate the app. We aim to release an update on Tuesday.

content:
Love the app, been using it for months but since updating to the latest 
version of Android the app does not work. When I try to open the app and 
start searching for a job the app crashes and shuts down. Please fix this!
replyContent: We are aware of this issue and will be releasing an update in the next few days to fix it. Please accept our apologies, but this was a completely unforseen incompatibility which was introduced in Pie. It only affects Android Pie users and you should still be able to use the My Times tab to operate the app. We aim to release an update on Tuesday.

content:
App works fine but there's no option to remove favourites from My Times, 
makes the feature very frustrating to use. Please add that in an update as 
well as the ability to reorganise the list in My Times.
replyContent: You can remove entries in My Times by clicking the RED minus symbol to the left of each entry. We plan on adding the ability to reorganize the entries in version 4.0.

content:
Great idea, backed by a massive database of development times. Too unstable 
to be useful, though. Good: -great database -good concept, separate timers 
for the different steps -good enough UI, everything is clear enough and 
fairly concise Bad: -Unstable. App crashes sometimes, timers will randomly 
reset or fail to start, sometimes the wrong timer will start (i.e., the fix 
timer will start instead of the stop bath timer) -Poor split screen 
support. Unstable enough in full screen, but split screen makes it worse. 
-No option to disable the sound. The agitation reminder noise could not be 
more annoying, and just aren't necessary. -No option to make it hands free. 
You need to physically push the continue button no fewer than 3 times 
during the development. -Awfully expensive for a glorified stopwatch. I 
like the idea for this app, and I absolutely swear by the database it uses. 
But being this unstable, especially for something time critical like film 
development, is unacceptable. It wouldn't be okay for a free app, and 
having to pay for an unusable experience is an insult. In its current 
state, don't bother with it. Use the online database, and just use a 
regular timer app. Fix the instability, add a few usability options to the 
menu, and it will be a fantastic app, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend 
it.
replyContent: The app is extremely stable and crash reports are very rare. Most issues are device-specific, so please use our support site to report problems so that we can fix them for you, or write to us for feature requests. Please see the online manual for instructions on how to set the auto-timer for hands-free usage or the many other useful features.

content:
I love this product and I hope you will have it translated to more 
languages like French, German and Finnish !!! Thanks again for all your 
work, crack on!
An invaluable tool for film development
Amazing app and just started getting into custom settings. Only wish I could add a pre soak option before development so I don't have to run a seperate timer outside the app.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. You can create a pre-soak step by setting Development A as the pre-soak, then Development B as the dev time. For more info, please see "How to edit Dev, Stop, Fix times" in the User Guide on our web site.

content: Very disappointing interface. Must open new window for EVERY possible combination. What is mostly needed is an overview for a given film or developer. A total waste of a fair bit of money.
replyContent: There are about 20,000 entries, so any menu system will take more than one click. This is why we created the My Times database, so that you can store and reuse the times you frequently require with just a single click. Its really fast and easy. For more details please see the User Guide on our web site.

content: Excellent now that the films are in order by manufacturer. That was the update this app needed.

This app is a godsend for black and white photography. My only complaint is that it's not really optimised for Android - it's clearly a straight port of the iOS version. If they remade this specifically for Android it would be 5 star easily. Minor issue though.
Extremely helpful!
Perfect
It would be nice if you could remove all of the developers you don't have on hand. Scrolling to the bottom to find Xtol gets a little annoying. That's the only gripe I've got so it could be worse.
I do not need anything else. It is very handy.
Awesome!
Doesn't work on One plus 2

I just moved from an iOS device to an Android, and the app is much worse. The appearance is outdated, the countdowns are buggy and the don't have the 3 second sound warning before the agitatition, which was my favourite feature. Just asked for a refund, not happy at all.
Apps very simpe and easy.
Simple to use and perfect results every time!  Well worth the price!
Superb resource, condensed into a very useful app. Highly recommended!

Easily the best timer/chart I have ever used. Developed all of my black and white film using this app and have gotten great results every time besides a few errors on my part once or twice! 10 stars, easily!
This program is an indispensable darkroom aid. The developer is extremely responsive too. If I could give six stars, I would.

The development times match the formidable online Massive Dev Chart - a serious font of knowledge - with the right amount of optional user customization.  The application is well thought out - just enough features; no bloated extras.  Way easier to use than a wristwatch.
Much better than using a standalone timer or the regular timer on the phone.
Good applications
The best timer ever with all the fomulas and times you need for every type of film ,for push and pull just brilliant .....for any pro or amateur is a must have!!!!!!!
Great tool but it let me down in critical moment of development by freezing my Galaxy S3 solid. Don't know what it is - worked fine when I was testing in for full 3 cycles. Some bug I'd guess.
replyContent: The app is being used by many other people with a Galaxy S3 and none of them (or anyone else) has reported this problem. The problem is almost certainly to do with something specific on your device and not with the app itself. Please contact us by email to request support so that we can help you resolve it.

content: Very useful.
Best app available and worth every penny.
Great app. Definitely worth the money. Must have for anyone developping film at home !
Super useful for anyone developing film at home

At first it took me a little bit to figure out the editing capabilities but one I understood this app became my best tool in and out (daylight tanks) of the darkroom. I'm a chart man for years and the idea of being able to input my custom time is perfect. I think my only suggestions would be the ability to move/arrange the my times list to remove the do-over frustrations. And possibly a way to port over the my times list to new phones/pads, etc. I resently had to update my plan and phone and in the process
replyContent: You can use the Share feature to export your data and import it to a new device.

content: This is a great app to add to your film developing process. It's easy to use and easy to modify. I suggest this app to everyone interested in film developing.

I haven't really used it much but it seems quite good. A few things would make this 5 stars: 1. When it's in red mode nothing stops someone from calling or the notification light from ruining the development. A do not disturb option would be great.  2. It's sometimes a little hard to find the film or developer that I have. If there was a way to group by manufacturer or hide the chemistry/film I don't have.  3. Fixing times are a setting rather than manufacturer recommend times.
Easy to use for amature
A very useful and simple App. A must for any lover of film photography!
Needs a fix for lollipop. Can no longer edit times and such since upgrade
replyContent: We have released 3.2.2 to fix the Lollipop bug.

content: After Lollipop update this morning I can't edit the time/temp part. Please help :)
replyContent: We have released 3.2.2 to fix the Lollipop bug.

content: Have used this for about 50 rolls of film with only a few inconsequential crashes and find it extremely useful. One thing I'd prefer is for the current level to take up the entire screen. It can maybe fade to the next stage...also  I'd prevent duplicates and add the ability  to order saved process combos!
replyContent: Thanks for the suggestions, we will aim to add the ability to sort your My Times entries to the next update.

content: Still not confident in this app.  Last thing I need is a bug to crash or freeze my timer mid- development.  Clearly people are working on the app and trying to improve user experience.   That said, I would never pay for this app when the database is free and you probably already have a film timer.
replyContent: Can you please email us directly to explain your concerns? The app is a lot more than a simple timer: it is highly configurable, reliable and well-tested, and includes many power features. We work very hard to make this app the very best it can be, so please write to us so that we can help you get the most out of it and address any issues.

content: I previously wrote a long-winded review and was pretty critical. Since then, (2 years?) i've been using this regularly. It is wonderful. I mean, spreadsheets and databases are nice but this is so much handier. The volume/measurement converter, the timers, the options. They packed everything they could think of in to this.
replyContent:
You can add your own data. Please see the User Guide here: http://www.digitaltruth.com/apps/mdc-manual.php

The instructions for editing an existing time should be sufficient. Otherwise, please view the instructions for creating your own entry for color processing. These instructions are equally applicable to black and white film.

content: Straightforward with all the right information.  I could be wrong but there seems to be no way to skip one of the stacked timers.  I wasn't using Hypo clear and couldn't find any way to skip to the wash timer.  Annoying!  I ended up taking the wash time to a separate timer.  Also if you reset the timer for any reason, you're all the way back to the beginning.  Should be an easy fix to allow you to tap any of the timers or even simpler just add a "skip to next step" button so you can at least cycle through.
replyContent: Any step can be removed by setting it to 00:00 zero.

content: Thank you for this so much. Worth every penny. I was using the free one so far, but every film fan should buy this.
Best way to make a simple task uneasy. What a messy, inconvenient navigation within the app. Seriously need an update to make it easier to use. This is not user friendly at all.
This APP is worth every second, & seconds are dollars. Get it! White Ras Lion, says!
Great app! Could have voice control and maybe a skip function. Not all of us use hypo. Just good old water
This is an invaluable tool for anybody that develops they're own film. This app covers more film and developer combos than imaginable.
The only feature I'd like that is missing would be voice control. Who wants to touch their phone with fixer or developer residue on their hands ?
An invaluable tool.
Brilliant app. Highly recommended.

I had an issue with the notification of mail asking me whether to use gmail or Massive Dev to open up the mail. If you select gmail and set as default, the phone would restart. This appears to affect note 2 only according to the developer.  After emailing the developer, I was given a temporary release appears to work again.
replyContent: The bug is not in the app: it is in the Notification/Gmail function. The problem appears to affect only a tiny number of users with the exact version of the OS you have on Galaxy Note. If you contact us by email we can supply you with an alternate version until your phone supplier updates the Android OS on your phone: that is the real issue.

content: 3.0.1. works as expected, again.  Some wishes The layout is wasting a lot of space on my tablet (Nexus 7). It would be nice if it would scale up the UI to make use of all the empty space. (especially a larger timer to see it from far away. Also, i think it would be nice if the UI would rotate if i rotate my device.
replyContent: Version 3.0.1 has been uploaded to the Play store and will be available later today. The agitation bug has been fixed in this update.

content: Just excellent.

The interface is not as polished, it could allow modifying the time when stopped (useful for example in wash cycles or for skipping steps). The clock should be bigger, the app wastes a lot of screen space. Also the times for TMax 100 in TMax Developer are way too high, seems like a bug because on the Massive Dev Chart page they are OK. And of course it could be cheaper. I almost asked for a refund.
replyContent: The times in the app are identical to the times in the online version of the chart; however, where there are multiple times for an identical combination the app automatically shows the most common published time. There are not many instances where this occurs, but your point is important so we will look into ways to include the additional times.

content: One of the best customer service around. I had issues with my Asus T700, but after I send a few scene shots, I got a reply that the development team would get right on it. The issues are 90% resolved and this update (2.2) was made available for my tablet again. This is the very best app for developing at home. Very complete and a great GUI.
Best value for the money for any app I've bought. Includes a number of obscure films.  I would like to see Kodak Vision 3 films added, though.
Very useful app but after the last update it keeps crashing when I try to save some default parameters such as the Volume.
replyContent: We have seen your crash report, but no other user has reported this problem and we cannot replicate it. Please contact us by email so that we can investigate this further and resolve it for you. It may be specific to your device.

content: Great app thanks...

Whilst I have not used the timers much, they do work well. The database is very good. I use caffenol or stand dev. It would be good to have more of these types of settings in. Apart from that its great.

Love this app, and enjoy combining new technology with old-school film processing. Can customise it for my own particular film types and processing, and the best thing is that after a break from processing film all my information will still be stored on my phone, and I won't have to go back to the internet to research all the mixing proportions and dev times and reinvent the wheel all over again! Useful as a searchable resource, a timer, and a data reference.

I use the digitaltruth website most of the time, but I bought the app too, to support it, even if I only use it as a database. I do not use the timer most of the time. I would love to see some more features, especialy automatic time adjustment for different temperatures, some interface upgrades like search, would be nice too. Still I am glad that the app exists!
replyContent: Automatic time/temp adjustment has always been available. To turn it on simply check the box in the time/temp field in the Edit screen.

content: Great app.
Great app. Really helpful when developing films
Fantastic tool, just wish you could re-order the favourites.
Having use this programme for a while. Suddenly the level of reminder alarm lower itself to very low volumn. No way to adjust it back. Very disappointed for this paid application.

I bought this app to show my support to the MDC website. It's my simple way of saying thanks. I have it installed on an HTC Desire A8181 and a Softbank 007SH Sharp Aquos. There are no crashes, startup failures, screen turning off, etc with the app (v1.3, Feb 2012) on both phones.  I understand the comments of the other users/reviewers, at the current price I would like to see more features and bug fixes. Features ... 1) include user can add his/her own films and not rely on a fixed list. 2) add a simple metronome feature ... 60bpm should be ok for film/paper developing needs. Bugs ... there is a "All times must not be set to zero!" bug when editing the Hypo Clear, Rinsing, Photo Flo settings. I'm trying to setup 0sec, 3min, 0sec for Hypo Clear, Rinsing and Photo Flo respectively (since I don't use them!) but the app won't allow me to do it.
Forces you to reset data after every update or it crashes. Timer lags and loses sound randomly. App is too big and won't let me move to SD card.
Be warned do not buy. Crashes every time i try and open it. Timer is useless. A real waste of money. Downloaded the updates now it refuses to open at all.

Reset itself mid way through the first dev process I tried with it and messed up my timings. Timer sort of sticks and freezes every few seconds which is bizarre, does not prevent phone sleeping and mutes while the phone is asleep meaning you miss the audio cues for agitation. You're better off sticking with the website and using a reliable stop-watch app than buying this, poorly put together, expensive and buggy app.
Would be better if it re calculated dev times when you change dilution settings. That's the whole point of having an app? Your website can do it.
Latest update makes the app unusable. Forced close on start up. Needs a fix asap.
Love this app, but the last update has made it unusable. Considering how much it costs, that sucks.
Well now after upday it crashes when i try to edit dev times or temp. Please fix soon
Timer loud and laggy. Expensive. Processes refer to steps that aren't explained and can't be skipped. Great idea and options though.
Does what it says on the tin but very laggy. HTC sensation.
Very responsive support

Seems to work well. Just ran it through a develop cycle. A few comments.... 1) High pitched clicks indicate agitation. Lower pitched ones are merely clock ticks. 2) Digital clock characters by default are animated and "squeeze" to indicate agitation cycles. This can be changed. 3) If you are using a battery App, make sure you "safe list" it if your App/Widget allows this. Otherwise it may kill off the App in the middle of your development cycle. 4) Has daylight and darkroom illumination setting
